TraceOutput class

Standard implementation of the Logger's framework IPublisher interface. Plain text formats incoming logging messages and sends them (traces) to the output window.

Author

Ralf Siegel

The TraceOutput class inherits from the Object class.

Implements

IPublisher

Constructor for the TraceOutput class

ConstructorDescription
TraceOutput()Constructs a new trace publisher with the default formatter

Method summary for the TraceOutput class

MethodDescription
TraceOutput.getFilter()Get the current filter for this Publisher.
TraceOutput.getFormatter()Gets the formatter currently associated with this publisher
TraceOutput.getLevel()Get the log level specifying which messages will be logged by this Publisher. Message levels lower than this level will be discarded.
TraceOutput.isLoggable()Check if this Publisher would actually log a given LogRecord. This method checks if the LogRecord has an appropriate Level and whether it satisfies any Filter. It also may make other Publisher specific checks that might prevent a publisher from logging the LogRecord.
TraceOutput.publish()Publish a LogRecord. The logging request was made initially to a Logger object, which initialized the LogRecord and forwarded it here. The Handler is responsible for formatting the message.
TraceOutput.setFilter()Set a filter to control output on this Publisher. For each call of publish the Publisher will call this Filter (if it is non-null) to check if the LogRecord should be published or discarded.
TraceOutput.setFormatter()Set a formatter for this publisher
TraceOutput.setLevel()Set the log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this Publisher. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.
